comment: The class was graded on 3 tests, their dates could not be made up or negotiated. It was open resource, and he would do review lectures the day before, so I would look at the practice problems, write down how to solve the ones I didn't understand, and use the notes on the test. Easy A as long as you stay on top of knowing when the tests are!
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: no homework, no disscussionseasy to get credit
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: 3 exams with 3 extra credit quizzes. first two exams pretty easy but the last one is tuff. Very long lectures. Your gonna be tempted to skip cause of how boring. But good teacher with a likable personality
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Gmeiner was a nice teacher, always ready to answer questions. For summer 2021, there were 3 extra credit quizzes and 3 exams. Revised with us before any test or exam (they were open notes). Provided the slides and handout summary of the textbook.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: The whole class is open note and your grade is based off of 3 exams and you are able to take an extra credit quiz before each exam. I don't think it would be possible to get anything less than an A in this class. If you have to take econ I 100% recommend this professor... trust me, this was my second time taking econ... he's the best.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: Robert only gives 3 test. If you fail one you fail the course, its that simple. Dont take him if your not a good test taker. Lockdown browser, no feedback. I personally wouldnt recommend him.
rating_tags: Graded by few things

comment: Only a few really easy open note quizzes
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: He is a tough teacher but is very straight forward and tells you exactly what to study. reading the material is essential to passing this class
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: 3 tests a year with extra credit, as long as you pay attention and take notes its an easy A. Gmeiner himself is pretty cool, very twangy/funny accent, the content of his lectures can be boring though.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I took Dr. Gmeiner for ECON 1000 and he made it as simple as it could be. There are only 3 tests throughout the semester but he gives a lot of extra credit quizzes that can easily boost you over a 100 on the exams. So long as you attend class, do the practice problems, and the extra credit, you will have no trouble making an A in this class.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: He offers extra credit quizzes each week because there are only 3 tests throughout the course. He provides lecture videos that are in great detail so pay attention to those. I got 70s on all my tests and got half credit on the credit quizzes and literally ended the class with an A. The textbook helps but I didnt use it that much.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: His grading scale is based on 3 tests if you miss one it's oh well you fail it and no makeups. This teacher is a nice man but very difficult to be in his class. He opens his test at the time of your class period and if you miss it even a minute late he will fail you. If you have a job good luck getting these test done especially with other classes.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: I finished with a B in the course. The only grades he puts in the grade-book all year is just 3 tests. So basically you cant mess up on a test or your A is gone. Wish he did more to help in terms of preparation when it came to tests, it kinda seemed like we were on our own for the most part left with just the book. Does offer extra credit though..
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Lecture heavy

comment: Good professor, I went to every lecture and he made sure to make it clear what was expected from us in order to pass. Read the syllabus, 3 tests in the semester with extra credit opportunity.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: He's a decent professor. Honestly just watch the lectures, read the handouts and look at the questions inside of the book and you will be fine.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Nice grading scale but tough tests
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Tough grader--Lecture heavy

comment: Prof Gmeiner was one of my favorite professors. Although he may seem very boring, he does a good job with lectures and has powerpoints for every unit accessible. He also gives extra credit and adds it to your test grades and even drops your lowest of the first three test grades. I'm upset to see him leave Kennesaw. Good teacher!
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: I really dont know how I got an A in the class because I didnt understand any material, I couldnt tell you a single thing I learned. God bless this man for making all of his online tests open book. He also gives 6 extra credit points per test if you choose to do so. Id take him again but only if it was an online class like mine was.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Only 3 graded tests. No one ever knew what was going on. He is willing to help outside of class. However, he teaches like we know the subject. His teaching style is not that effective & needs improvement.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Really easy class and he teaches the material very well imo. Graded on 4 tests, but as long as you went to the lectures or read the PowerPoint you'll do fine, plus he offers 10 points extra credit for every test. You don't have to show up to class as he posts everything online, but he is very good about answering any questions in class. I recommend
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Super straightforward tests and I actually learned the material in the class because he tests you on what he teaches. There is only 4 tests and he will drop your lowest one in the end. Extra credit points for each test. Its a pretty boring class but I considered it to be an easy A with some light textbook reading and attending the lectures.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Only 4 graded assignments: 3 tests & an excel. No one ever knew what was going on. The transition online was harder because due dates remained the same. He is willing to help outside of class. However, he teaches like we know the subject. Straight from PPT & does not break it down well. His teaching style is not that effective & needs improvement.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Reads off powerpoints directly, word for word, and posts them online. No point in going to class. He's a nice teacher but the class could easily be online. Gives TONS of extra credit.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Tough grader

comment: Good professor. Everything on the test is in his lectures, on the powerpoint slides, and in the book. Easiest econ class I've taken. Only 3 tests. You don't have to show up to class, though it is encouraged. He's accessible outside of class. No HW. The only reason I'm giving him a 4/5 is bc his lectures are VERY boring.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: One of the few professors I have taken that truly works with his students to help them understand the material. He is accessible outside of class and is always willing to help. During the Covid-19 pandemic, he went above and beyond what most professors did and worked with his students. His class can be challenging, but he gives extra credit.
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: This professor is pretty boring, not going to lie. But he is very passionate in trying to help his students. He always makes an effort to try to help his students as much as possible so you can pass. I wouldn't say he is an easy A because you are only graded on 4 tests (the lowest dropped) but he definitely offers lots out outside help.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Easily the most boring professor imaginable, It's extremely hard to pay attention to a professor who both has an annoying voice and can only teach off of a power point. The class is entirely graded off of 4 Tests which makes this class 10x harder. Try and take this class with a professor who can actually teach a class without boring you to death!!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: This was easily the most boring class with the most boring prof. I've ever taken! Reads lectures straight from the slides, which he then uploads. In my section the ONLY grades were the 3 tests we had, so you have to do well on the tests or you won't pass. that being said, i showed up to like 6 classes tops and got a B
rating_tags: Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: If you take good notes and study from the book, it is an easy A. Gives extra credit, only 3 test the entire year. Even though you attendance isn't mandatory, go to class to listen to his lectures. All of the questions on the test are in the back of the book so test aren't hard, just study the book and it is easy.

Great guy. A solid choice for an easy A in ECON1000. Not the most personable or interesting Professor but his lectures are incredibly easy to follow along with and he has a great way of explaining tough concepts. Attendance was not mandatory and the only grades were 3 tests. Show up for lectures and do the practice problems and you'll get an A.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: This class was so easy to pass. As long as you study the PowerPoints and do the practice problems you will pass the three test he gives. Attendance isn't mandatory. I recommend this class for anyone who wants an easy A without going to class regularly.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: Great Professor. Easy class as long as you study and put in some work. When hes not teaching from the PowerPoint hes telling you about how much money he could be making if he chose to work in the private sector.

great professor! attendance not mandatory. just study for the tests and you're good. always 33 questions on the test. 2 lowest test grades are worth 30% and the highest test grade is worth 40%. most of the questions are exactly like the ones in the textbook. put a little bit of effort in and you will see good test results
rating_tags: Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: He's a very great professor! His tests practically mirrored the practice problems in the book and he's very nice. Please take him!
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Graded by few things

comment: He's a good professor and knows what he is talking about. Only 3 tests and the tests aren't too bad but you do have to study. Nice guy.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Explains what he wants you to know effectively. speaks clearly and loudly. answers questions well. goes over tests before the tests. also gave extra credit for the test people did the worst on. everything is organized on d2l properly. no complaints from me.

Dr. Gmeiner is a really easy professor. He reads straight from the ppt and attendance isnt required so you dont need to come to pass. His lectures may be boring but you can tell he knows a ton about his field and wants you to pass. Only 3 tests, no quizzes, homework, or anything else. He does 1 extra credit assignment.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class--Graded by few things
